item.title: What is this place?
item.description:
What is this place?

Welcome to my feed of interests!

item.title: Digital innovation is 'key to securing London's future' - Imperial expert
item.description:
Digital innovation is 'key to securing London's future' - Imperial expert

London must harness the potential of smart technologies to meet the future needs of its citizens, a major new report shows. Penned by the Smart London Board - which is chaired by Imperial's Vice President (Innovation), Professor David Gann CBE - the report says that London must capitalise on its digital expertise to tackle challenges associated with the city's bourgeoning population - set to exceed 10 million people by 2036.

item.title: Multibillion-euro innovation hub slammed by auditors
item.description:
Multibillion-euro innovation hub slammed by auditors

An ambitious initiative to fuel innovation in the European Union has swallowed up enormous amounts of money, but has little to show for the investment, its auditors say. Backed with almost â‚¬3 billion in EU cash, the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT) was established in 2008 to stimulate economic growth in the EU by transferring research and innovation from academia into commercial applications.

item.title: How Facebook is slowly eating the rest of the Internet
item.description:
How Facebook is slowly eating the rest of the Internet

Om nom nom nom nom By Teddy Amenabar You can now stream live to Facebook, and Mark Zuckerberg wants you to know it's a big deal. But Facebook's latest feature is more than just the ability to post live video for your friends to see.

item.title: Mace Ranch Innovation Center put on hold
item.description:
Mace Ranch Innovation Center put on hold

Plans for the Mace Ranch Innovation Center are hold, as developers announced Wednesday that they need to take a step back to look at the project's financial feasibility. The announcement follows the release of the most recent economic analysis by Economic & Planning Systems Inc., which estimated that the project would generate less than half the revenue of similar innovation centers.

item.title: First ExoMars image excites Red Planet scientists (PHOTOS)
item.description:
First ExoMars image excites Red Planet scientists (PHOTOS)

A joint EU-Russian mission to search for life on the Red Planet has released the first image beamed back to Earth from the ExoMars spacecraft. The ExoMars craft is undertaking a seven-month journey to the planet, carrying a Trace Gas Orbiter (TGO) and the Schiaparelli lander module.

item.title: Working for yourself is not freedom. - Life Learning
item.description:
Working for yourself is not freedom. - Life Learning

The myth of the entrepreneurial good life. Talking to some of the founders I've met over the past six months, I've encountered an overwhelming majority who want to found businesses to achieve freedom and a work-life balance. Their idea is that if they became their own boss, life would be a lot easier.

item.title: Pollenwarndienst: Free pollen app
item.description:
Pollenwarndienst: Free pollen app

Our free pollen app provides current values for all of Austria and Germany, and all useful information about pollen allergy when you are on the go.To download the app to your Android or iOS device, follow the instructions below.

item.title: CaptionBot is Microsoft's latest AI experiment - and at least it isn't racist
item.description:
CaptionBot is Microsoft's latest AI experiment - and at least it isn't racist

After the somewhat awkward experience last month of having an AI Twitter bot go full-on racist in a few hours once it interacted with humans, Microsoft have released a new AI experiment on to the internet - CaptionBot.

item.title: Why You Should Encrypt Everything and the Reason You Probably Don't
item.description:
Why You Should Encrypt Everything and the Reason You Probably Don't

Most of the more than 2.5 billion people who use email have more than one account, and 95 percent of the email they send is unencrypted. In real numbers, that's just over 194 billion emails sent every day in the clear.
